Jeff Pollard

Software engineer. Rubyist. Dog owner. Music lover.

Overview

  • Experienced, dependable and driven software engineer.
  • Broad experience with a wide variety of open-source tools and technology.
  • Strong focus on web technologies, including front-end, back-end and operations.

Core Skill Set

  • Ruby: Rails, Sinatra, RSpec, Resque, Bundler, Unicorn, Capistrano, metaprogramming.
  • Front End: HTML5, CSS3, Haml, SASS, Javascript (jQuery mostly), AJAX, Mustache.
  • PHP: 5 years experience, last used 2009, CakePHP 1.1.
  • HTTP: Apache, Passenger, HAProxy, Nginx, REST.
  • Miscellaneous AMQP, RabbitMQ.
  • Databases: MySQL, Riak, Redis, SQL.
  • Operating Systems: OSX, Linux/BSD (Ubuntu).
  • Operations: AWS (EC2, S3, EBS, ELB), server setup and troubleshooting.
  • Source Control: Git, Subversion.
  • Development Practices: MVC, TDD/BDD, continuous integration.
  • Dabble In: Erlang, Python, Bash, Java, Scala, C.
  • Non-Technical: UX, project management, agile development practices.

Open Source

  • Author of Distillery, a ruby gem to extract the content portion of an HTML document.
  • Author of Gazzette, a ruby gem to interact with the Instapaper Simple API.
  • Author of rspec-encoding-matchers, a gem providing RSpec custom matchers for string encodings in Ruby 1.9.
  • Maintainer of http_status_exceptions, a Rails plugin to use exceptions for generating HTTP status responses.
  • Further contributions to Rudy, Ripple and guard-rspec.

Work Experience

  • Software Engineer

    SEOmoz, Seattle, WA

    Nov 2009 – Present

    • Helped design, develop and create Rails campaign manager application, servicing 30,000+ active customer campaigns daily.
    • Created initial version of crawl processing system, which processed thouands of crawler data dumps every day. Processing output fed into reports inside campaign manager application.
    • Architected and developed application sharding solution, allowing further growth and scalability of existing Rails application and supporting infrastructure.
    • Designed, developed and launched rankings collection system to successfully collect and process 2.5+ million rankings per week. Implemented using Resque, Redis and Riak.
    • Developed single sign-on solution to standardize user authentication across all SEOmoz applications.
    • Architected and created HTML, Javacript and CSS for company-wide shared navigation. Utilized mustache templating engine to share templates amongst PHP and Ruby applications.
    • Worked closely with operations engineers to monitor, diagnose, troubleshoot and fix operations issues across a variety of technology stacks.
    • Integrated user accounts and billing system with Infusionsoft CRM product.

  • Chief Technology Officer

    SEOmoz, Seattle, WA

    September 2007 – October 2009

    • Oversaw all SEOmoz engineering, including personnel management, high-level technology strategy, implementation and day-to-day project management.
    • Led and managed hiring efforts to grow development team from two to eight developers. Conducted weekly one-on-one meetings with all engineering team members.
    • Established software development processes and best practices, such as source control, agile development methodology, unit testing and deployment standardization.
    • Designed and developed upgraded customer accounts and billing system. New system offered a more modern, user-friendly and integrated user experience. Further upgraded system to be capable of selling DVDs and other physical items.
    • Designed and developed the first version of the SEOmoz Firefox toolbar. Integrated toolbar with Linkscape API and user authentication system, enabling specific toolbar feature sets for specific customer SKUs.

  • Web Developer

    SEOmoz, Seattle, WA

    June 2006 – August 2007

    • Developed SEOmoz SEO Services Marketplace, used by thousands of SEO professionals to post resumés, job openings and project proposals.
    • Completed many web development projects for SEOmoz consulting clients, including ecommerce implementations and custom CMS solutions.
    • Maintained and added new features to the main SEOmoz website.

  • Web Developer

    Florentine Design Group, Bothell, WA

    December 2005 – June 2006

    • Worked on a variety of client websites, mostly on customized eCommerce installations.
    • Created AJAX-powered wedding invitation customization application.

Education

  • B.A. Geography, Geographic Information Systems (GIS)

    University of Washington, Seattle, WA

    2005

Other Interests

  • Pasionate lover of all kinds of music. Goes to many music shows and festivals through the year, including Bumbershoot, Decibel Festival and pretty much any show by any artist on Ninjatune.
  • Beer lover and part-time home brewer. A questionable amount of time is spent in new cities finding and visitng local breweries.
  • Airplane nerd. Have traveled to Osh Kosh, Wisconson and braved 90° heat and humidty on multiple occasions for the annual EAA airshow.
